citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A calf had hair loss and a scab that extended around the front half of its eye. The hair loss and scab had been observed
prior to inspection, but the Attending Veterinarian had not been contacted prior to inspection. Hair loss and a scab
indicates the calf may have some kind of infection. The infection may be contagious not only to other animals, but to the
employees and the general public. In addition, the area around the eye may be irritating to the calf. The licensee must
contact the Attending Veterinarian and initiate a treatment plan to treat the area surrounding the calf's eye. Correct by
6/13/23.

Nail and screw heads were sticking out of boards on the goats' wooden playground/play structure. Nail and screw heads
sticking out present a hazard as the goats could step on these and injure their hoof. All nail and screw heads sticking out
either need to be removed, hammered or screwed in, or the structure needs to be replaced. Correct by 6/26/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A calf had hair loss and a scab that extended around the front half of its eye. The hair loss and scab had been observed 
prior to inspection, but the Attending Veterinarian had not been contacted prior to inspection. Hair loss and a scab 
indicates the calf may have some kind of infection. The infection may be contagious not only to other animals, but to the 
employees and the general public. In addition, the area around the eye may be irritating to the calf. The licensee must 
contact the Attending Veterinarian and initiate a treatment plan to treat the area surrounding the calf's eye. Correct by 
6/13/23. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Nail and screw heads were sticking out of boards on the goats' wooden playground/play structure. Nail and screw heads 
sticking out present a hazard as the goats could step on these and injure their hoof. All nail and screw heads sticking out 
either need to be removed, hammered or screwed in, or the structure needs to be replaced. Correct by 6/26/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
